posts.cooked:
This Sheet is private

So I made a spreadsheet that compares all of the COTS swerve modules currently on the market (that I know of) with lots of different values for each one. There are a couple inconsistencies with listed manufacturer values (in particular MAXSwerve height and Thrifty Swerve weight) because height & weight are calculated based on a base height and weight and the height and weight of the motors for that row, and for some reason it didn’t line up. For MAXSwerve and Swerve XS, weight is using a NEO 550 as a turn motor. I’m sure I got at least one thing wrong, so please tell me (also if you have a good idea for another metric to compare the modules based on/another swerve module I haven’t heard of).

One thing that would neat to see in your comparison is if gear ratio options are included with the module or if it’s an additional purchase for teams. Once you have to buy other ratios, things are to get more expensive.

Added! If anybody knows

WCP 2023-24 | Product Release & Updates

if it’s possible to buy an X1/X2/X3 ratio set without buying more Swerve X/X Flipped/XS modules

that would be great. I currently listed extra gear ratios for all WCP swerve modules at the price that they are listed as in their respective module buying pages, but couldn’t find them listed separately, so I don’t know if it’s possible.

posts.cooked:
For motor support I’ve gone with what the manufacturer website lists. That’s why Kraken X60 isn’t listed for MAXSwerve even though people have done it . According to REV’s website :

…

Azimuth driven by NEO 550 Brushless Motor & UltraPlanetary Gearbox

…

So I think I won’t list that as an option.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: Any chance you will be updating this to account for the WCP modules that just released?
I can definitely do that, though I think I’ll wait until they release SwerveXS 2 as well.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: good thinking!

This is cool but I believe the Mk4i is corner biased, per SDS : “The MK4i is the flipped motor, corner biased version of the MK4 module.”

Great spreadsheet though.
I probably don’t understand what corner biased means. I thought it meant that there were different versions for different corners, like the mk4n?

posts.name: Paul Regnier
posts.cooked: Corner biased means the wheel is moved towards the corner of the frame, where tubing would be if the module was not corner biased. I believe every current module but the normal Mk4 and SwerveX uninverted are corner biased.
SwerveX (and XS and flipped) has both tube and corner mount. Would the tube mount be not corner biased and the corner mount be corner biased?

posts.name: Paul Regnier
posts.cooked: WCP SwerveX and SwerveX2 (but not XS), are available in either corner biased or non corner biased configurations. (sorry for very late response)
